content.description: Source: Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance, 2018.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why Nigeria’s turnout is much lower than that of the other countries?

choices.label: In addition to logistical issues, Nigerians lack faith in the political system and are not encouraged to vote.
Nigerians have high levels of efficacy and do not believe it is necessary to vote in presidential elections.
International oil and gas companies paid millions of dollars to Nigerians so they would not vote in elections.
Nigeria’s Boko Haram insurgency prevented many Nigerians from voting in the 2015 election, especially in large cities.

content.answer: In addition to logistical issues, Nigerians lack faith in the political system and are not encouraged to vote.
